channel.title: Overview-rss on MySqlConnector: Async MySQL Driver for .NET and .NET Core
channel.description: Recent content in Overview-rss on MySqlConnector: Async MySQL Driver for .NET and .NET Core

item.title: Installing
item.description:
Installing

The recommended way of installing MySqlConnector is through NuGet

Step 1: Add MySqlConnector to the dependencies in your project.json file:

{
  "title": "My Application",
  "description": "A great application",
  "dependencies": {
    "MySqlConnector": "0.*",
    // other dependencies
  },
  // other config
}

Step 2: Run the command dotnet restore

item.title: Known Issues
item.description:
Known Issues

  • Not all MySQL data types are supported.
  • Many MySql.Data connection string settings are not supported by this library. See Connection Options for a list of supported options.
  • Only the mysql_native_password and mysql_old_password authentication plugins are supported.

item.title: Version History
item.description:
Version History

0.18.2

  • Fix excessive memory usage with BufferResultSets=true: #244.

0.18.1

  • Support new MySQL Server 8.0.1 collations: #242.
  • Specify preferred collation when resetting connection: #243.

0.18.0

  • Support System.Transactions transaction processing: #13.
  • Add AutoEnlist connection string option: #241.
  • Throw better exception for unsupported ParameterDirection: #234.
  • Fix StackOverflowException reading a large blob: #239.

0.17.0

  • Implement cancellation of the active reader: #3.
  • Add MySqlErrorCode: #232.
  • Implement a connection pool reaper to close idle connections: #217.
    • Add ConnectionIdleTimeout connection string option: #218.
  • Implement ConnectionLifeTime connection string option: #212.

0.16.2

  • Fix exceptions when server resets the connection: #221.

0.16.1

  • Throw a better exception when max_allowed_packet is exceeded: #40.

0.16.0

  • Implement MySqlParameterCollection.AddWithValue: #127.
  • Thanks to michi84o for contributions to this release.

0.15.2

  • Include help on AllowUserVariables in exception message: #206.

0.15.1

  • Fix NullReferenceException in MySqlConnection.Database: #205.

0.15.0

  • Implement MySqlConnection.ChangeDatabase: #201.
  • Add Buffer Result Sets connection string option: #202.

0.14.1

  • Fix exception when MySqlDataReader isn’t disposed: #196.

0.14.0

  • Update System.* package references: #190.

0.13.0

  • Add MySqlBulkLoader: #15.
  • Thanks to gitsno for contributions to this release.

0.12.0

  • Add support for DateTimeOffset: #172, #175.
  • Thanks to SÃ©bastien Ros for contributions to this release.

0.11.6

  • Fix PlatformNotSupportedException on AWS Lambda: #170.
  • Thanks to Sebastian for contributions to this release.

0.11.5

  • Further improve async and sync performance: #164.

0.11.4

  • No changes in this release.

0.11.3

  • Improve async performance: #164.

0.11.2

  • Fix InvalidCastException when using aggregate functions: #54.

0.11.1

  • Handle IOException in MySqlSession.DisposeAsync: #159.

0.11.0

  • Implement the SslMode=Preferred connection string option and make it the default: #158.

0.10.0

  • Change minimum supported .NET Framework version to .NET 4.5.1: #154.

0.9.2

  • Fix MySqlConnection.DataSource with Unix Domain Socket: #152.

0.9.1

  • Fix SocketException when calling OpenAsync: #150.

0.9.0

  • Implement Treat Tiny As Boolean connection string option: #141.

0.8.0

  • Implement Keep Alive connection string option: #132.

0.7.4

  • Fix Packet received out-of-order exception with UseCompression=true: #146.

0.7.3

  • Fix GetDataTypeName for ENUM and SET columns: #52, #71.

0.7.2

  • Fix authentication for MySQL Server 5.1: #139.

0.7.1

  • Fix NextResult incorrectly returning true, which may cause problems with Dapper’s QueryMultiple: #135.
  • Reduce memory usage related to Enum.HasFlag: #137.

0.7.0

  • Implement stored procedure support: #19.
    • Known issue: NextResult incorrectly returns true, which may cause problems with Dapper’s QueryMultiple: #135.

0.6.2

  • Fix NullReferenceException when MySqlParameter.Value == null: #126.

0.6.1

  • Fix AggregateException going unhandled in OpenAsync: #124.
  • Fix SSL over Unix domain sockets.
  • Reduce allocations when using SSL certificates.

0.6.0

  • Implement UseCompression connection string option: #31.
  • Add support for Unix domain sockets: #118.

0.5.0

  • Implement UseAffectedRows connection string option. (Note that the default value is true, unlike MySql.Data.)

0.4.0

  • Rename SslMode enum to MySqlSslMode (for compatibility with MySql.Data):#102.

0.3.0

  • Add SSL support and SslMode connection string option: #88.
  • Rewrite protocol serialization layer to support SSL and make adding compression easier: #93.

0.2.1

  • Add more diagnostics for unsupported auth plugins.

0.2.0

  • Add MySqlConnectionStringBuilder.ForceSynchronous: #91.
  • Thanks to Ed Ball for contributions to this release.

0.1.0

  • First non-alpha release. Supports core data access scenarios with common ORMs.

item.title: Configuration
item.description:
Configuration

MySqlConnector uses a connection string in order to connect to your database.

To connect to a database on localhost port 3306 with a user mysqltest, password Password123, and default schema mysqldb, the connection string would be:

host=127.0.0.1;port=3306;user id=mysqltest;password=Password123;database=mysqldb;

For all connection string options, view the Connection Options Reference

Application Database Object Example

It’s a good idea to use an IDisposable object that configures the connection string globally, and closes the connection automatically:

public class AppDb : IDisposable
{
    public readonly MySqlConnection Connection;

    public AppDb()
    {
        Connection = new MySqlConnection("host=127.0.0.1;port=3306;user id=mysqltest;password=Password123;database=mysqldb;");
    }

    public void Dispose()
    {
        Connection.Close();
    }
}

Callers can use the Application Database Object object like so:

public async Task AsyncMethod()
{
    using (var db = new AppDb())
    {
        await db.Connection.OpenAsync();
        // db.Connection is open and ready to use
    }
    // db.Connection was closed by AppDb.Dispose
}

public void SyncMethod()
{
    using (var db = new AppDb())
    {
        db.Connection.Open();
        // db.Connection is open and ready to use
    }
    // db.Connection was closed by AppDb.Dispose
}

item.title: Use with ORMs
item.description:
Use with ORMs

This library is compatible with popular .NET ORMs including:

  • Dapper (NuGet)
  • NReco.Data (NuGet)
  • SimpleStack.Orm (NuGet)

For Entity Framework support, use:

  • Pomelo.EntityFrameworkCore.MySql (NuGet)
